Data.event_text: General Luis Fernando Navarro says that illegal armed groups lost 5,120 members in 2020. The number includes deaths, capture, and desertions. He said the National Liberation Army (ELN) still has 2,450 members and Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) has 2,500.

links.text: -Acosta, Luis Jaime; Griffin, Oliver (January 5, 2021). Baum, Bernadette (ed.). "Colombia's illegal armed groups lost more than 5,000 members in 2020 -military commander". Reuters. Retrieved January 5, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Scientists say the cocaine hippos in the Magdalena river basin are breeding voraciously and are an increasing menace so they must be culled.

links.text: -Charles, Matthew (January 17, 2021). "Colombia's rapidly breeding 'cocaine hippos' must be stopped, scientists say". news.yahoo.com. The Telegraph. Retrieved January 18, 2021.-

Data.event_text: FARC changes its name to Comunes ("Commoners").

links.text: -"Former Colombian guerrillas shed their decades-old name". news.yahoo.com. AP. January 25, 2021. Retrieved January 25, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Notorious paramilitary commander, drug trafficker, and sexual abuser of young girls Hernán Giraldo Serna ("El Taladro") finishes his sentence in the United States and returns to Colombia.

links.text: -"Some Colombians fear ex-paramilitary leader deported from US". AP NEWS. 25 January 2021. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: 647 Haitian nationals, 23 Cubans, and 19 migrants from African countries are stranded on a beach in Necoclí, Antioquia Department, hoping to pass through the Darién Gap to Panama and, eventually,  the United States.

links.text: -"Colombia reports almost 700 migrants stranded in Caribbean region". Reuters. 29 January 2021. Retrieved January 29, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Seven adults and seven children are killed and 16 people are missing after two boats collide near Tumaco, Nariño Department.

links.text: -"Colombia boat disaster: Search continues for missing". BBC News. February 2, 2021. Retrieved February 8, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Cuba warns of an attack on Bogotá by the ELN in the "next few days." Mayor Claudia López Hernández and Defense Minister Diego Molano Vega say they take the threat seriously.

links.text: -"Bogota taking rebel attack threat 'very seriously': mayor". msn.com. AFP. February 10, 2021. Retrieved February 10, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Ten former members of FARC are killed in a military bombing on Calamar, Guaviare. Three "dissidents" are captured.

links.text: -"Ten rebels killed, three captured in Colombia military bombing". Reuters. 3 March 2021. Retrieved March 4, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A 26-year-old woman and her 4-year-old daughter are killed in a landslide in Siloé, Cali.

links.text: -"Madre e hija de 4 años murieron en deslizamiento de tierra en Siloé, Cali". infobae (in European Spanish). March 10, 2021. Retrieved March 11, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A car bomb explodes in Corinto, Cauca, injuring eleven. A later report indicates 43 were injured.

links.text: -"At least 16 injured in Colombia car bomb blast". news.yahoo.com. Reuters. March 27, 2021. Retrieved March 27, 2021.-
-"Atentado con coche bomba deja 43 personas heridas en Colombia". jornada.com.mx (in Spanish). La Jornada. March 27, 2021. Retrieved March 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: The government sets up a camp in Arauquita, Arauca, Arauca for 4,700 refugees from Apure, Venezuela.

links.text: -"Casi 5 mil venezolanos cruzaron la frontera por los combates y Colombia instalará un centro de atención para migrantes". infobae (in European Spanish). March 30, 2021. Retrieved March 30, 2021.-

Data.event_text: - Gásper, a rescue dog at the Bogotá Fire Department's Puente Aranda station, goes missing during a search operation at Guadalupe Hill. His disappearance receives much local, national news coverage and sympathy from the public. He is found 2 days later on the 29th.

links.text: -"Los personajes que tuvieron su cuarto de hora en el 2021 en Bogotá" [The characters who had their fifteen minutes of fame in 2021 in Bogotá]. El Tiempo. 31 December 2021. Archived from the original on 2 January 2022. Retrieved 19 August 2024.-

-"Los personajes que tuvieron su cuarto de hora en el 2021 en Bogotá" [The characters who had their fifteen minutes of fame in 2021 in Bogotá]. El Tiempo. 31 December 2021. Archived from the original on 2 January 2022. Retrieved 19 August 2024.-
